sentences.en: ‘Stay right there,’ she ordered.
sentences.cn: “待在那儿。”她命令道。

sentences.en: A point of order was raised in parliament by Mr Ben Morris.
sentences.cn: 本·莫里斯先生在议会就程序问题提出质询。

sentences.en: A surprising number of customers order the same sandwich every day.
sentences.cn: 每天点同一种三明治的顾客多得惊人。

sentences.en: At other times the discrepancy was of the order of 20%.
sentences.cn: 往常的出入约为20%。

sentences.en: Goods will be sent within 24 hours of receiving your order.
sentences.cn: 货物将于收到贵方订单后24小时内发出。

sentences.en: He said that the order was outgrown for the situation.
sentences.cn: 他说在那种形势下，该命令已不适用了。

sentences.en: he slouched into his seat in order to avoid drawing attention to himself.
sentences.cn: 他蜷缩着坐到自己的座位上以免招人注意。

sentences.en: I’ve ordered a new computer from the supplier.
sentences.cn: 我向供应商订购了一台新的电脑。

sentences.en: It is a good idea to place your order well in advance.
sentences.cn: 早早就提前下单是个好主意。

sentences.en: It's great to have you back. Congratulations are surely in order!
sentences.cn: 你回来真是太好了，就等着向你道贺呢！

sentences.en: Just phone in your order three or more days prior to departure.
sentences.cn: 在出发的三天之前打电话预订即可。

sentences.en: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.cn: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.en: Manufacturers must list ingredients in order of the amount used.
sentences.cn: 生产商必须按用量多少的顺序将成分列出。

sentences.en: Midge clapped her hands, calling them back to order.
sentences.cn: 米奇拍手示意他们安静下来。

sentences.en: sales increases are of the order of 20%.
sentences.cn: 销售上升大约是２０％。

sentences.en: She keeps her room in good order.
sentences.cn: 她把自己的房间保持得很整洁。

sentences.en: She now makes wonderful dried flower arrangements to order.
sentences.cn: 现在她为顾客定做漂亮的干花插花。

sentences.en: Someone comes in every day to check all is in order.
sentences.cn: 每天都有人来检查是否一切都井然有序。

sentences.en: staff must be committed to the change in order for it to succeed.
sentences.cn: 为了使改革获得成功，全体员工必须支持它。

sentences.en: The captain had to give the order to abandon ship.
sentences.cn: 船长不得不发出弃船的命令。

sentences.en: The company invested thousands in an electronic order-control system.
sentences.cn: 公司耗资数千购买了一套电子订单管理系统。

sentences.en: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.cn: 法院下令放他出狱。

sentences.en: The highest Order of Knighthood is the Order of the Garter.
sentences.cn: 最高骑士勋位是嘉德勋位。

sentences.en: The house projects an atmosphere of calm and order.
sentences.cn: 这栋房子透着一种宁静和整齐感。

sentences.en: The soldier disobeyed an order.
sentences.cn: 这名士兵违抗了命令。

sentences.en: The waiter returned with their order and Graham signed the bill.
sentences.cn: 侍者把他们点的餐端了过来，格雷厄姆签了单。

sentences.en: The waiter took our orders.
sentences.cn: 服务生给我们点餐。

sentences.en: The waiter took our orders.
sentences.cn: 服务生给我们点餐。

sentences.en: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.cn: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.en: Troops were sent to the islands to restore order last November.
sentences.cn: 去年11月，军队被派往这些岛屿以恢复秩序。

sentences.en: Williams ordered him to leave.
sentences.cn: 威廉斯命令他离开。

words.tran_cn: [数] 有序的；整齐的；安排好的
有秩序的；整齐的；值班的
[贸易] 订货人；开证申请人
订购；[计] 排序；[计] 定序
命令；点餐（order的过去式和过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: (数)大小级次，数量级；绝对值的大小，绝对值的阶
在定购中（已定而尚未交货的）
属于…同类的；与…相似的；近似
约为，大约；订货；注尺寸顺序
秩序！安静！（会议、议会等主持人用语）
违反会议（或议会等）程序的

trans.tran_cn: 次序，条理，治安，命令，订货，点菜，付款指令，秩序，阶层，（生物）目，修会，授勋的人，勋章，社团，汇票
trans.tran_en: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

trans.tran_cn: 命令； 点菜； 订货
trans.tran_en: to ask for goods or services to be supplied
